captions.text:
Good afternoon.
My name is Edward Cole.

l don't know what most people say
at these occasions. because...
...in all honesty. l....
l've tried to avoid them.
The simplest thing is...
...l loved him and l miss him.
Carter and l saw the world together.
Which is amazing...

...when you think that only
three months ago...
...we were complete strangers.
l hope...

...that it doesn't sound
selfish of me...
...but the last months of his life...
...were the best months of mine.
He saved my life.
And he knew it before l did.

EDWARD:
l'm deeply proud that thís man...

...found ít worth hís whíle
to hnow me.
ln the end...

...l thính ít's safe to say that we brought
some joy to one another's líves.
So, one day, when...
...l go to some fínal restíng place...

...íf l happen to wake up
next to a certaín wall wíth a gate...
...l hope that Carter's there...
...to vouch for me...

...and show me the ropes
on the other síde.

title: The Bucket List (4/4) Movie CLIP - He Saved My Life (2007) HD

comments.text:
Awe... You cut off my favourite line!
It was supposed to say

"I know that when he died, his eyes were closed and his heart was open. And 
I'm pretty sure he was happy with his final resting place, because he was 
buried on the mountain. And that was against the law."
﻿
comments.author: joanna lo

comments.text:
ONE OF THE MOST TOUCHING SCENES IN THE HISTORY.. I was bawling like a child 
during this scene﻿

comments.text:
This reminds me of my grandpa. I think that im the only one that is almost 
thinking every second about him. He was the only one that knowed me really 
good but then he died of cancer. :( rip my friend almost 5 years ago. But i 
will never forget you. :)﻿

comments.text: old people bromance at its best﻿
comments.author: dougie quaid

comments.text:
Such a beautiful movie, amazing chemistry between Jack & Morgan. Rather 
than any old casting they put two legends together and the sincerity, 
depth, humour and real character showed, I was so lost in the story it had 
me choked at the end. Such a great story and a good lesson about what 
matters, finding your Joy.﻿
comments.author: TheSamBlonde

comments.text:
Saw this movie today in school ,really effective. No one walked out of that 
class without a broken heart.﻿

comments.author: Toasties

comments.text:
Roger Ebert hated the film. His reason is actually understandable, even 
though I liked this movie: he suffered from cancer (which killed him a few 
months ago), and he felt the film was depicting cancer as something to just 
brush off or laugh about when it really isn't.

comments.text:
If you only knew how he straightened me out since then. There were so many 
lies told to me, and it was Dad who set me straight! There isn't enough 
space to tell you all the lies I was lead to believe were true.

comments.text: Thanks! That means a lot!

comments.text:
Sorry to hear that man... hope he stays strong and keep your head up. He 
would have wanted you to even if he wasn't around. Think of it that way.
comments.author: TranceForLyfe

comments.text:
"I think the simplest thing is I love him, and I miss him." That line makes 
me cry so hard. When my best friend died no one really knew how hard it hit 
me, and to this day its really hard for me to watch this because of that 
line. I still love him, and I still miss him.
comments.author: Connor Lowe

comments.text: Why critics didn't enjoyed this as we did.

When my best Friend died i couldnt even pronounce this same thing such

comments.author: patrick shansey

comments.text:
My father and I have gotten closer since my mother died, and I may use that 
line, "The last months of his life were the best months of mine," at his 
service when I eulogize him. I just hope that's not for awhile yet! I love 
you, Dad!
comments.author: vccstudents

comments.text:
"The last months of his life were the best months of mine." That line STILL 
CHOKES ME UP! My father was watching this just after my mother died. I am 
so glad I got away before this scene, or we both would have been 
blubbering! Jack Nicholson, you're the best!
comments.author: vccstudents

Every single scene from this film is just perfect, the chemical between

watched this movie several times, and even when I know almost all of the

comments.author: jakko pg

comments.text:
I read somewhere that they filmed this scene on very last day of shooting 
so there could be real going away emotions. Same thing was done in 1982 in 
E.T. when his departure scene was also filmed last and all emotions shown 
on-screen were real.
comments.author: Fatima Ahmad

comments.text:
Scene like this can't be acting. Jack is not acting. These are true 
emotions. Movie is so emotional that he can't contain his sadness that 
movie is having sad ending.
comments.author: Fatima Ahmad

comments.text:
I haven't cried for over twenty years, but I did cry whole night after 
watching this scene and hearing this speech. Jack Nicholson and Morgan 
Freeman indeed are two greatest living actors in world. And this movie 
cemented that status. Every single scene and every single line in this 
movie are already immortal.
comments.author: Fatima Ahmad
